name: Sodium
description: Massive performance booster that rewrites Minecraft’s rendering; usually doubles or triples FPS.
features: Better and faster chunk rendering
Stabilizes FPS in heavy areas
Smooth lighting improvements
Works with shaders through Iris
howTo: Just install it and configure options under Options → Video Settings.

name: Lithium
description: Speeds up Minecraft’s game logic like AI, physics, and block ticks.
features: Mob-heavy areas run more smoothly
Reduces random lag spikes
Works on both servers and clients
howTo: Runs automatically once installed; no extra setup needed.

name: FerriteCore
description: Cuts memory usage by optimizing block and model data.
features: Lowers overall RAM usage
Helps big modpacks run more comfortably
Useful on lower-memory machines and servers
howTo: Install on client and/or server; no configuration required.

name: Krypton
description: Optimizes networking for smoother online play.
features: Reduces packet overhead
Faster chunk loading over the network
Can help lower effective ping on servers
howTo: Install on the server for best effect; clients can also use it.

name: GlitchCore
description: General optimization and stability tweaks for Fabric mods.
features: Improves stability for large Fabric modpacks
Includes various performance patches behind the scenes
howTo: Drop it into your mods folder; it quietly helps everything behave.

name: Athena
description: Boosts performance for detailed decorative block models.
features: Optimizes complex block models from decor/structure mods
Helps builds stay pretty without tanking FPS
howTo: Install alongside decorative/structure mods; no config needed.

name: Alternate Current
description: Reimplements redstone dust to drastically cut lag from complex circuits while keeping behavior vanilla-like.
features: More efficient redstone power calculations
Reduces excessive block updates
Makes redstone update order predictable and stable
howTo: Install on client and server; existing redstone builds will just run faster.

name: Iris Shaders
description: Modern shader loader designed to be compatible with most OptiFine shader packs and to work great with Sodium.
features: Loads many existing OptiFine shader packs
Built to be fast and compatible with modpacks
Pairs nicely with Sodium for high-FPS shaders
howTo: Install Iris like any other Fabric mod.
Drop shader packs into the shaderpacks folder and enable them in Video Settings → Shader Packs.

name: Moonlight Lib
description: Library mod required by several worldgen and structure mods.
features: Powers multiple structure and worldgen mods
Keeps worldgen features consistent and compatible
howTo: Install whenever another mod lists Moonlight Lib as a dependency.

name: Balm
description: Shared code library used by several QoL mods.
features: Provides a common API for many mods
Required for mods such as Traveler’s Backpack
howTo: Install if any of your mods require Balm; no extra setup.

name: TerraBlender
description: Lets biome mods hook cleanly into world generation.
features: Allows multiple biome mods to coexist
Used by mods like Biomes O’ Plenty
howTo: Install alongside biome/worldgen mods that ask for it.

name: Fabric API
description: Core API library for the Fabric modding toolchain used by most Fabric mods.
features: Provides common hooks and interoperability for Fabric mods
Lightweight and modular APIs
Frequently updated for new Minecraft versions
howTo: Install Fabric API for almost any Fabric modpack unless a mod explicitly says it doesn’t need it.

name: Cloth Config API
description: Configuration library that provides in-game config screens for many mods.
features: Lets mods expose options via a unified config UI
Supports Fabric and other loaders
Widely used dependency in modern packs
howTo: Install when a mod lists Cloth Config as a dependency; access config from Mod Menu or the mod’s own buttons.

name: Fabric Language Kotlin
description: Enables the Kotlin programming language for Fabric mods.
features: Required for any Kotlin-based Fabric mods
Loader-version based, not content-version based
Maintained by the Fabric team
howTo: Install whenever a mod lists Fabric Language Kotlin as a dependency.

name: Cardinal Components API
description: Component system that lets mods attach custom data to entities, items, chunks, and more.
features: Fast and modular component API
Used by many Fabric/Quilt mods internally
No user-facing GUI, just required in the background
howTo: Install if a mod requires Cardinal Components; no configuration needed.

name: GeckoLib
description: 3D animation library for entities, blocks, armor, and more.
features: Keyframe animation system for modded models
Used by many creature and boss mods
Supports advanced animation events and effects
howTo: Only needed because other mods depend on it; install when required.

name: Puzzles Lib
description: Shared library used by multiple mods, providing cross-loader utilities and abstractions.
features: Common code for several large mods
Helps keep multi-loader mods consistent
Pure backend dependency; no direct gameplay changes
howTo: Install Puzzles Lib whenever a mod lists it as a dependency.

name: Resourceful Lib
description: Utility and API library used by Team Resourceful’s mods and others.
features: Networking and GUI helpers
APIs for predicates, tags, and recipes
Used by mods like Resourceful Bees and others
howTo: Install if a mod requires Resourceful Lib; no direct configuration needed.

name: MidnightLib
description: Lightweight library that provides shared utilities and a flexible config system.
features: Automatic integration with Mod Menu config screens
Common helpers for multiple MidnightDust mods
Tiny footprint, often bundled as Jar-in-Jar
howTo: Install when a mod lists MidnightLib as required.

name: oωo (owo-lib)
description: General utility, GUI, and config library for Fabric and Quilt mods.
features: Declarative UI system for mod menus
Config and networking helpers
Backend for many modern Fabric mods
howTo: Install whenever a mod lists owo-lib as a dependency.

name: PneumonoCore
description: Core library mod that Pneumono_’s mods depend on, including Gravestones.
features: Shared utilities used across multiple Pneumono_ mods
Required for Gravestones and related content
Client and server library for Fabric/Quilt
howTo: Install PneumonoCore if a mod like Gravestones asks for it.

name: More Axolotl Variants API
description: Lightweight API that lets other mods add custom axolotl variants while staying compatible.
features: Allows registering new axolotl variants
Supports custom axolotl bucket item models
Used by content mods that expand axolotls
howTo: Install when a mod requires MAVAPI; it does not add variants on its own.

name: YUNG’s API
description: Library mod providing shared utilities and worldgen helpers for YUNG’s structure overhauls.
features: Required by YUNG’s Better Strongholds/Fortresses and other YUNG mods
Worldgen helper utilities
Pure backend dependency
howTo: Install whenever a YUNG’s mod lists YUNG’s API as required.

name: Traveler’s Backpack
description: Adds functional backpacks with tiers, abilities, and a full GUI.
features: Portable inventory with lots of slots
Upgradeable backpacks with special abilities
Can be worn or placed as a block
howTo: Hold the backpack and Right-Click to open it.
Press B to open while equipped (keybind configurable).
Use the Equip button in the GUI to wear it.
Upgrade backpacks via the Smithing Table.

name: Carry On
description: Lets you pick up blocks, containers, and mobs with your bare hands.
features: Move chests, furnaces, and machines without breaking them
Carry mobs for relocation or silly screenshots
howTo: Shift + Right-Click with empty hands to pick up a block or mob.
Right-Click to place what you’re carrying.

name: AppleSkin
description: Adds hunger and saturation overlays directly to your HUD.
features: Shows how much a food item will restore
Displays saturation values
Shows when you will start healing
Displays exhaustion gain
howTo: Install it and enjoy the extra HUD info; configurable in mod options.

name: JourneyMap
description: Adds a minimap, fullscreen map, waypoints, and death markers.
features: Automatic map generation as you explore
Waypoints and death markers so you don’t get lost
Configurable minimap and fullscreen map
howTo: Press J for the fullscreen map.
Press O for minimap options.
Press B to create a waypoint.

name: Waystones
description: Adds teleportation stones you can find or craft.
features: Teleport between activated waystones
Craftable and naturally generated stones
Warp scrolls and items for flexible travel
howTo: Right-Click a waystone to activate it.
Use an activated waystone to teleport to others.
Craft warp scrolls and other items for remote travel.

name: Decorative Blocks Reborn
description: Adds beams, seats, pillars, supports, and other aesthetic blocks.
features: New decorative beams, seats, pillars, and supports
Perfect for cozy builds and detailed structures
howTo: Craft the new blocks and use them like any other building block.

name: Macaw’s Furniture
description: Adds chairs, tables, wardrobes, desks, and lots of decor pieces.
features: Many different furniture styles and colors
Great for decorating bases, shops, and houses
howTo: Craft furniture in the crafting table and place it around your builds.

name: Chipped
description: Adds thousands of block variants for builders.
features: New workstation: Chipping Bench
Huge catalog of decorative variants for many vanilla blocks
howTo: Use the Chipping Bench to convert blocks into their fancy variants.

name: Critters and Companions
description: Adds cute animals like otters, seals, dragonflies, snails, and koi fish.
features: Many new passive and ambient creatures
Great for cozy, lively worlds
howTo: Explore the world to find new critters in their natural habitats.

name: Living Things
description: Adds lots of new mobs to the world, focusing on a vanilla-friendly style.
features: Many new animals and creatures to discover
Works well in exploration-heavy packs
Integrates cleanly with Fabric API
howTo: Install and explore; new mobs spawn naturally in appropriate biomes.

name: Vanilla Degus
description: Adds a new tamable rodent mob, the Degu, in a very vanilla-friendly style.
features: New cute tamable mob
Fits naturally into vanilla worlds
Good companion for cozy players
howTo: Find Degus in the world and tame them with their preferred food (see mod page or JEI).

name: Waddles
description: Adds cute Adelie penguins that waddle around cold biomes.
features: Penguins spawn in cold regions
Adorable ambient wildlife
Great for snowy base aesthetics
howTo: Travel to cold biomes and look for penguins wandering on ice and snow.

name: More Axolotl Variants Mod
description: Adds a bunch of new axolotl variants with different colors and looks.
features: Multiple new axolotl skins and variants
Some special variants are only breedable
Pairs with MAVAPI for compatibility
howTo: Breed axolotls and search rivers and caves to encounter the new variants.

name: Ecologics
description: Overhauls and expands various vanilla biomes with new mobs, blocks, foods, and structures while staying close to vanilla style.
features: Adds biome-specific mobs like crabs and camels
New trees, foods, and small structures
Vanilla-friendly art and balance
howTo: Generate a new world and explore common biomes to find Ecologics’ new content.

name: Custom Nether Portals
description: Lets you build nether portals in almost any shape, size, and orientation.
features: Portals can be built in custom shapes
Place portals on floors, walls, or ceilings
More creative freedom for nether access builds
howTo: Build a portal frame in your chosen shape with obsidian, then light it like a normal nether portal.

name: Bosses of Mass Destruction
description: Adds challenging, unique boss battles to the game.
features: Bosses like the Nether Gauntlet, Void Blossom, Frostmaw, and The Harbinger
Each boss has its own arena and mechanics
Drops strong gear and unique rewards
howTo: Follow the in-game advancements or wiki for how to summon each boss.

name: Deeper and Darker
description: Adds The Otherside, a sculk-themed dimension tied to the Warden.
features: New biomes like Deeplands, Echoing Forest, Overcast Columns, and Blooming Caverns
Ancient temples and other sculk ruins with dangerous mobs
New blocks, armor, tools, and the Soul Elytra
howTo: Defeat the Warden and obtain its special drop.
Use it on the mod’s portal structure to enter The Otherside (see the mod’s guide).
Use the Soul Elytra’s active ability to launch yourself into flight.

name: Eternal Starlight
description: Large RPG-style dimension mod focused on exploration, bosses, and rare materials in a magical starlight realm.
features: New dimension with unique biomes and structures
Progression through powerful bosses and enemies
End-game materials used by some big modpacks
howTo: Follow the mod’s progression (often via quests or advancements) to obtain the items needed to open the Starlight portal.

name: Oblivion
description: Adds a forgotten, extremely dangerous dimension intended for late-game players only.
features: New hostile dimension with brutal terrain and mobs
High risk, high reward gear and resources
Designed for tough combat-focused players
howTo: Use the in-game guide or advancements to learn how to build and activate the portal to Oblivion.

name: Paradise Lost
description: A Skylands/Aether-inspired dimension with floating islands, new biomes, and unique structures.
features: New sky dimension with floating islands
Fresh plants, mobs, and resources
Dungeons and structures with custom loot
howTo: Craft a Bloomed Calcite portal frame, flood it with water, and step through to reach Paradise.

name: The Bumblezone
description: Bee-themed dimension that looks like the inside of a giant hive, full of honeycomb terrain, structures, and angry bees.
features: Honeycomb maze-like terrain with canals and walls
Unique bee armor and items
Special structures and the Bee Queen
howTo: Enter the dimension using its special hive-based portal mechanic (see the mod’s wiki for the exact method).

name: Illager Invasion
description: Expands Illagers with many new enemy types, structures, and tougher raids.
features: New Illager variants with unique abilities
Additional Illager structures around the world
Harder village raids with extra enemies
howTo: Explore to find new Illager structures and trigger raids as usual; they’ll naturally include the new mobs.

name: Biomes O’ Plenty
description: Adds 60+ new biomes and a full worldgen overhaul.
features: Tons of new overworld biomes with unique blocks and plants
Great for exploration-focused worlds
howTo: Make a new world with the Biomes O’ Plenty world type if needed.
Press F3 to see biome names and look them up on the wiki.

name: Hopo Better Mineshafts
description: Replaces mineshafts with huge, more realistic mining tunnels.
features: Massive, interconnected mine networks
More interesting layouts and loot than vanilla mineshafts
howTo: Explore underground to discover revamped mineshafts in new worlds.

name: Hopo Better Underwater Ruins
description: Improves ocean ruins with larger layouts and better loot.
features: Bigger, more intricate underwater ruin structures
Better loot and more reasons to explore the ocean floor
howTo: Swim or boat around oceans to find the new ruins.

name: YUNG’s Better Strongholds
description: Massively overhauls strongholds into full dungeons.
features: Huge, multi-path strongholds with loops and secrets
More interesting End portal journeys
howTo: Find strongholds as usual with Eyes of Ender; they’ll be upgraded in new worlds.

name: YUNG’s Better Nether Fortresses
description: Overhauls Nether fortresses with new rooms, layouts, and loot.
features: Larger, more dangerous Nether fortresses
New rooms, secrets, and loot opportunities
howTo: Explore the Nether to find the upgraded fortresses.

name: Structory
description: Adds lots of small and medium structures across the overworld.
features: Dozens of new structures scattered around the world
Makes exploration feel busier and more lived-in
howTo: Just explore; new structures appear naturally in new worlds.

name: Terralith
description: Massive overworld worldgen overhaul that keeps vanilla blocks but creates dramatic new landscapes.
features: Dozens of custom biomes and terrain shapes
Uses only vanilla blocks for great compatibility
Pairs well with structure and mob mods
howTo: Create a new world with Terralith installed; existing worlds won’t get the new terrain in already-generated chunks.

name: Stellarity
description: Extremely large End overhaul datamod with new terrain, biomes, items, and mechanics.
features: Reworks the End with unique fantasy-style biomes
Adds new structures, items, and weapons
Focuses on exploration and late-game progression
howTo: Start a new world or explore untouched End chunks to see Stellarity’s new content.

name: Simple Voice Chat
description: Adds proximity and group voice chat directly in Minecraft.
features: Proximity chat around nearby players
Group and party channels
Configurable microphone and audio options
howTo: Press V to open the voice chat menu (default keybind).
Configure push-to-talk and mute options in the menu.

name: Gravestones
description: Stores your items safely in a grave when you die.
features: Keeps your inventory in a grave at your death location
Stores XP so you can recover it
howTo: When you die, a grave spawns at your death location.
Break the grave to collect your items and stored XP.

name: Just Enough Items (JEI)
description: Recipe and item-use viewer built into your inventory.
features: Search for items and see crafting recipes
View all uses for an item
Great for modded packs with complex recipes
howTo: Hover an item and press R to see its recipes.
Hover an item and press U to see its uses.
